  • Constructor Details

    • Host

      public Host()
      The Host function is the main function of the Host class. It creates a new thread for each client that connects to it, and then runs a loop which waits for messages from clients. When it receives one, it checks if its an end game message or not. If so, then the host will send out all scores to all players and close down their threads (and thus disconnect them). Otherwise, if its just a normal move message from one player to another (or itself), then we simply update our board model with this move and send out an updated board state to everyone else in the game.

  • Method Details

    • setNickName

      public void setNickName(String NickName)
      The CreateProfile function creates a profile for the user.

    • start

      public void start()
      The start function creates a new thread and runs the runServer function in it. This is done so that the server can be running in the background while other functions are being executed.

    • runServer

      public void runServer() throws IOException
      The runServer function is the main function of the server. It opens a socket with a given port and waits for clients to connect. When it receives a client, it adds him to its list of guests and starts handling his requests in another thread.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • SendStartGameMessage

      public void SendStartGameMessage(String hostNickName)
      The SendStartGameMessage function is used to send a message to all the guests in the game. The message contains information about who is hosting, and what tiles they have been assigned.
      Parameters:
      hostNickName - Send the host's nickname to all clients

    • sendPassTurnMessage

      public void sendPassTurnMessage()
      The sendPassTurnMessage function is used to send a message to all players in the game that it is their turn. This function will be called when the host player passes his/her turn.

    • sendStopChallengeAlive

      public void sendStopChallengeAlive()
      The sendStopChallengeAlive function is used to send a message to all the players in the game, telling them that they should stop sending challenge alive messages. This function is called when a player has been found cheating and therefore needs to be removed from the game. The host will then call this function so that no more challenge alive messages are sent by any of the players in order for them not to get confused about which player was kicked out of the game.

    • sendEndGame

      public void sendEndGame(String winner)
      The sendEndGame function is used to send a message to all players in the game that the game has ended.
      Parameters:
      winner - winner Identify the winner of the game

    • getWinner

      public String getWinner()
      The getWinner function returns the name of the player with the highest score.
      Returns:
      The name of the player with the highest score

    • sendUpdatePrevToCurrent

      public void sendUpdatePrevToCurrent()
      The sendUpdatePrevToCurrent function is used to send the previous state of the game to all players. This function is called when a player has just joined and needs to be updated on what has happened in the game so far.

    • CreateMessageToGameServer

      public String CreateMessageToGameServer(String message, String socketSource)

      Parameters:
      message - message Send a message to the game server
      socketSource - socketSource Determine which socket to send the message to
      Returns:
      A string

      Parameters:

      prevScore - Send the previous score of the player to the server
      action - Determine the action to be taken by the client

    • SendSuccessMessage

      public String SendSuccessMessage(String destination, int newScore, String action, String newCurrentTiles, String hostNickName)
      The SendSuccessMessage function is used to send a success message to the client.
      Parameters:
      destination - Determine which client the message is being sent to
      newScore - Update the score of a player
      action - Specify the action that was performed by the player
      newCurrentTiles - Send the new current tiles to the client
      hostNickName - Identify the host of the game
      Returns:
      A string containing a json object

    • SendSucceededChallengeYouMessage

      public String SendSucceededChallengeYouMessage(String hostNickName, String prevScore)
      The SendSucceededChallengeYouMessage function is used to send a message to the client that indicates that the challenge has been accepted. The function takes in two parameters, hostNickName and prevScore. It then creates a new MessageHandler object and calls its CreateSucceededChallengeYouMessage function with these two parameters. Finally, it returns the json string created by this call as its return value.
      Parameters:
      hostNickName - hostNickName Identify the host of the game
      prevScore - prevScore Send the previous score of the host to the client
      Returns:
      A string

    • SendUpdateBoardMessage

      public void SendUpdateBoardMessage(String board, String hostNickName)
      The SendUpdateBoardMessage function is used to send the updated board state to all of the guests in a game.
      Parameters:
      board - Send the board to the client
      hostNickName - Identify the host of the game

    • handleClient

      public void handleClient(InputStream inputStream, OutputStream outputStream)
      The handleClient function is the function that handles all of the communication between the client and server. It reads in a JSON string from the input stream, then puts it into an input queue for processing by another thread. The handleClient function also writes to an output stream, which sends data back to the client. This is how we send messages back and forth!
      Specified by:
      handleClient in interface ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      inputStream - Read from the server
      outputStream - Write to the server

    • handleRequests

      public void handleRequests()
      The handleRequests function is responsible for handling all the requests that are sent to the host. It handles them by using a switch case, and then sending back an appropriate response.

    • HandleChallenge

      public void HandleChallenge(boolean res, String prevScore, Word w)
      The HandleChallenge function is called when a player challenges another player's word. If the challenge succeeds, then the tiles that were used to form the challenged word are returned to their respective bag and removed from the board. The board is updated accordingly and sent back to all players in order for them to update their boards as well. A message is also sent back indicating that a challenge has succeeded, which will be handled by each client individually (see Client class).
      Parameters:
      res - res Determine whether the challenge was successful or not
      prevScore - prevScore Update the score of the player who challenged you
      w - w Get the row and column of the word public void handlechallenge(boolean res , string prevscore, word w) { if(res) { system

    • handleGameServer

      public void handleGameServer(InputStream inputStream, OutputStream outputStream)
      The handleGameServer function is a function that handles the input and output streams of the game server. It reads an object from the server, puts it in a queue, and then sends an object to the game server.
      Parameters:
      inputStream - inputStream Read the data from the server
      outputStream - outputStream Send data to the server

    • reduceTilesFromCurrentTiles

      public List<Character> reduceTilesFromCurrentTiles(String word, List<Character> currentTiles)
      The reduceTilesFromCurrentTiles function takes in a word and the current tiles of the player. It then reduces the number of tiles from the currentTiles list by removing all letters that are used to form a valid word. The function also generates new tiles for each letter removed from currentTiles, so that there are always 7 letters in total.
      Parameters:
      word - Check if the word is valid
      Returns:
      The new current tiles after reduce and generate

    • GenerateTiles

      public List<Character> GenerateTiles(int number)
      The GenerateTiles function takes in an integer number and returns a list of characters. The function generates the number of tiles specified by the input parameter, and adds them to a list.
      Parameters:
      number - Determine how many tiles the player gets
      Returns:
      A list of characters

    • close

      public void close()
      The close function is used to close the Host's ServerSocket and all of its Guest Sockets. It also removes this Host from the Main Server's list of active hosts.
      Specified by:
      close in interface ClientHandler
